territory.notes: Following the death of El Hadj Omar Tall in 1864 (who had conquered the earlier Kingdom of Kaarta in 1854, bringing it into Tall’s Tukulor Empire), Kaarta was ruled by relatives of Tall’s son who never fully recognized the son’s authority as the inheritor of the Ségou-Tukulor Empire. Thus, from 1864 to 1890, Kaarta was nominally part of the Ségou-Tukulor Empire, but effectively independent from it. French troops defeated Kaarta/Tukulor forces in 1890, conquering Kaarta and bringing it into the French Sudan.
